page.title: 15SHOPS
page.content: The front half of the shop is not as old as the back half. There are four bedrooms and three rooms downstairs that are not used for the shop. The front two rooms and one side room are used for the shop and Post Office. The main shop has a wooden counter and three freezers, there is a special area with a little counter for the Post Office section. The building is a listed building as the rear of the building is over 350years old. The newer part of the building was added 150years ago. As a result of this the door frames in the old part of the building are much lower, so if you see people walking around Ingoldsby with bumps on their heads they have probably been visiting the family in the shop.
